verb.description: Send (someone) back to their own country.
examples: the United Nations hopes to repatriate all the refugees

noun.description: A person who has been repatriated.

origin: Early 17th century (earlier ( late 16th century) as repatriation): from late Latin repatriat- returned to one's country, from the verb repatriare, from re- back + Latin patria native land.
